result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon C Branch

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon C Branch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for Brandon C Branch.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests more time for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph P Bastien in court, defendant Brandon C Branch not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense request additional time for review. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Brandon C Branch in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Brandon C Branch in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty for Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense request bail hearing. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brandon C Branch in court with Attorney Joseph P Bastien; both appear by video.  Defendant Brandon C Branch in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective R. Smith. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. State requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  Arraignment scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph P Bastien in court, defendant Brandon C Branch not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for order to show cause hearing. Atty Bastien has now been appointed. Defense waives prelim time limits. Case adjourned for prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon C Branch in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for STATE V. LEE hearing, however SPD has not yet made an appointment. SPD Office not present and has not provided Court with an update at this time. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing. Case adjourned in Branch 04.  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon C Branch not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for a State V-LEE hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon C Branch not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon C Branch not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list. Limited Curfew from 8pm to 7am.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No contact order signed and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
XSH
JXM III
CBW

Defendant Brandon C Branch in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Brandon C Branch in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon C Branch appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
